radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is incompletely distended with multiple gallstones and positive ___ sign on exam. There is no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid, and the common bile duct is not distended at 3 mm. Incidentally noted are multiple polyps throughout the gallbladder. The liver is normal in echotexture with no focal lesions. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The pancreas is obstructed by bowel gas and not fully evaluated.
